etymology.description: 萅 constitutes an early form of 春(春) (chūn, "spring"). Initially, as 春, it was a phono-semantic compound: 艸(艸) (cǎo, "grass") + 屯(屯) (tún, "sprout") for phonetics + later addition of 日(日) (rì, "sun") symbolizing growth. Over time, 艸(艸) and 屯(屯) merged into 𡗗.
etymology.interpretation: 萅 represents an early step in the evolution of 春(春) (chūn, "spring"), highlighting the essential elements of sprouting plants signified by grass and sprouts under the sun — symbolizing the burgeoning growth of spring.

examples.chinese: 萅日融融(萅日融融)，百花盛开(百花盛開)。
examples.english: The spring day is warm, and the flowers are in full bloom.

examples.chinese: 我爱萅季(我愛萅季)，万物更新(萬物更新)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ ài chūn jì, wànwù gēngxīn.
examples.english: I love the season of spring, when all things are renewed.
